subject: Travel
subcategory: The Story of Maps and Navigation
title: The Mercator Projection
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Mercator Projection.

hook.text: The world map on most classroom walls is distorted. Greenland looks the same size as Africa, but Africa is 14 times larger.

buildup.text: Gerardus Mercator created his projection in 1569 to help sailors plot straight-line courses on maps.

discovery.text: The projection stretches land near the poles and shrinks land near the equator to keep compass bearings accurate.

twist.text: This makes Europe and North America look much larger than they are relative to Africa and South America.

climax.text: Critics say it reinforced colonial views by visually inflating the size of wealthy northern nations.

punchline.text: The most common map in history distorts the entire world.

quiz.question: Why did Mercator create his map projection?
options: To help sailors plot straight-line courses
